title.narrative: MATERNAL AND CHILD HEALTH

description.narrative: By 2022, the Ministry of Health has strategies and tools in place to improve access to and the coverage and quality of maternal and child health services and services for adolescents in priority areas, By 2022, the Ministry of Health has strategies and tools in place to improve access to and the coverage and quality of maternal and child health services and services for adolescents in priority areas, applying a risk management approach., which contributes to Fast-Track The End Of Hiv/Aids, Health And Development In Early Childhood And Adolescence, Immunization Services As Part Of Primary Health Care, Mental Health And Psychosocial Well-Being, Nutrition Of Adolescents And Women, Strengthening Primary Health Care And High-Impact Health Interventions, Strengthening Primary Health Care And High-Impact Health Interventions (Covid). UNICEF aims to achieve this through Advocacy And Communications, Advocacy And Public Engagement, Systems Strengthening And Institution Building, Systems Strengthening To Leave No One Behind. This contributes to the following Country Programme result: By 2022, mothers, children, adolescents and families, especially the most vulnerable (on the northern border, indigenous peoples, Afrodescendants and others) and/or in emergency situations, exercise their right to health, education, water and sanitation and to informed and effective participation, with a focus on early childhood and adolescence

condition.narrative: Should contribute directly to results for children as outlined in the UNDAF, national results and/or UNICEF Strategic Plan and within the scope defined in the CPD, CPAP, OMP or other agreed upon programme documents

title.narrative: By 2022, the Ministry of Health has strategies and tools in place to improve access to and the coverage and quality of maternaland child health services and services for adolescents in priority areas, By 2022, the Ministry of Health has strategies and toolsin place to improve access to and the coverage and quality of maternal and child health services and services for adolescents inpriority areas, applying a risk management approach.

description.narrative: The CO supports national government efforts to deliver comprehensive and quality care for mothers and children. COVID-19 hindered the continuation of strategies previously supported by the CO. This year, the CO has striven to strengthen essential health and nutrition services through an initiative to establish mother and child-friendly healthcare facilities. The CO also supports community-based surveillance models to promote community participation in monitoring children and pregnant women’s access to essential healthcare and maternal health services. The aim is to prevent maternal and child morbidity and mortality and mother-to-child HIV transmission. | Status:Partially met | As-of Date:18/01/2022
